page.title: 02WILDLIFE IN NE FINZEAN.
page.content: {Lapwings (-) and oystercatchers}breed in the arable fields and{3-4 pairs of {curlew and skylarks}in grassland. {Rabbits}are abundant but{brown {hares}have become rare in the last 12 years.{Flocks of fieldfares(300),}with {some redwings and rooks(200)}come to the fields in winter. No Dutch Elm disease is present yet. {Silver Birch}is the main species in the limited no. of broadleaves. {Redpolls}breed there and{Trientalis grows under them.The riverside woods are still continuous , mainly{alder and{bird cherry. Otters}occur:{mink have arrived in the last 10 years. {Moorhens}have become rare.{Dippers, {Grey Wagtails and Common Sandpipers breed beside the Feugh. {Pipistrelle}bats are common in Summer and{butterflies}feed in the gardens.
